intro: Juncus sudeticus, commonly known as the eastern rush, is a perennial plant native to eastern Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, such as along the edges of ponds, lakes, and wet meadows. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are usually green to reddish in color, and it produces small, clustered spikes of pale green or brown flowers. It is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality. Juncus sudeticus is also a valuable food source for various insects and birds.
